title: Algorithms and Data Structures
description: Questions about algorithms and data structures

questions.question: What does the time complexity of an algorithm describe?

answers.a: The amount of memory the algorithm uses
answers.b: The execution time of the algorithm as a function of input size
answers.c: The number of variables in the algorithm
answers.d: The number of lines of code in the algorithm

questions.question: Which notation describes the upper bound of an algorithm's time complexity?
What is the basic characteristic of a stack?
Which operation removes an element from a stack?
What is the time complexity of push and pop operations in an ideal stack implementation?
What is the basic characteristic of a queue?
Which operation adds an element to a queue?
Why is a circular queue used?
What is true for an empty circular queue?
Which data structure is used in recursion?
What must every recursive function have?
What is an advantage of a singly linked list over an array?

answers.c: Easier insertion and deletion of elements

questions.question: What is the main disadvantage of a singly linked list?

answers.b: Slow access to an arbitrary element

questions.question: Which sorting algorithm has an average complexity of O(n log n)?
Which sorting algorithm is stable?
What is the basic characteristic of a heap?

answers.b: Complete binary tree with the heap property

questions.question: What is true for a max-heap?

answers.a: The smallest element is at the root
answers.b: All leaves are greater than the root
answers.c: The root contains the largest value
answers.d: Elements are sorted in ascending order

questions.question: What is the time complexity of building a heap?
What is the main difference between a tree and a graph?
How many edges does a tree with n nodes have?
